basic.description: In this seminar course, students will examine and evaluate critically the influence of lifestyle and lifestyle modification on cardiovascular and cerebrovascular health and disease.  Specifically, students will study 1) the relation between cardiovascular and cerebrovascular health and chronic illness, 2) the relation between lifestyle risk factors for ischemic heart disease and cerebrovascular disease, 3) the effects of lifestyle modification (eg., exercise, diet) on recovery  following a myocardial infarction, coronary artery bypass graft surgery, angioplasty or stroke, 4) the effects of lifestyle modification (e/g/. exercise, diet) on promoting health and reducing modifiable risk factors for ischemic heart disease and cerebrovascular disease of their effects. 3 hours lecture per week for 12 weeks 9 units (3 credits).
basic.subject: NURS
basic.title: Lifestyle & Cardiovascular
